products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-watsonx-ai
products.label: Cloud automation for watsonx.ai
products.short_description: Creates and configures an instance of IBM watsonx.ai Studio, Runtime, and Project.
products.long_description:
With [IBM watsonx.ai](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/getting-started/overview-wx.html?context=wx&audience=wdp#watsonxai), you can build, train, and deploy AI models at scale in a secure, enterprise-grade environment. This deployable architecture provisions watsonx.ai Studio, Runtime, and a KMS-encrypted project with storage delegation for Object Storage. It also includes optional tools for key encryption and observability, giving you everything you need to manage your watsonx.ai deployment with confidence.

ℹ️ This Terraform-based automation is part of a broader suite of IBM-maintained Infrastructure as Code (IaC) assets, each following the naming pattern "Cloud automation for *servicename*" and focusing on single IBM Cloud service. These single-service deployable architectures can be used on their own to streamline and automate service deployments through an [IaC approach](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secure-enterprise?topic=secure-enterprise-understanding-projects), or assembled together into a broader [automated IaC stack](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secure-enterprise?topic=secure-enterprise-config-stack) to automate the deployment of an end-to-end solution architecture.

features.title: watsonx.ai Studio
features.description: Get started with watsonx.ai by provisioning Studio—a collaborative environment for building, training, and evaluating AI models. [Learn more](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/svc-welcome/wsl.html?context=cpdaas).

features.title: watsonx.ai Runtime
features.description: Get started with watsonx.ai by deploying Runtime to efficiently serve and manage machine learning and foundation models in production. [Learn more](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/svc-welcome/wml.html?context=cpdaas&audience=wdp).

features.title: watsonx.ai Project
features.description: Get started with watsonx.ai by creating a Project to organize your datasets, notebooks, models, and other assets in one place. [Learn more](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/manage-data/manage-projects.html?context=cpdaas).

features.title: Optional user profile setup
features.description: Use watsonx.ai with a preconfigured [user profile](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/manage-data/admin-project.html?context=wx&audience=wdp&locale=en) that grants admin access to manage projects and associated resources efficiently.

features.title: Optional Object Storage integration
features.description: Use watsonx.ai with [Cloud Object Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-getting-started-cloud-object-storage) to store and manage project data. You can provide an existing instance or use [Cloud automation for Object Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cos-68921490-2778-4930-ac6d-bae7be6cd958-global) to create a new one.

features.title: Optional encryption with Key Protect
features.description: Use watsonx.ai with [Key Protect](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/key-protect?topic=key-protect-about) to enable encryption for Object Storage and secure your project data. You can bring your own KMS instance or create one using [Cloud automation for Key Protect](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cos-68921490-2778-4930-ac6d-bae7be6cd958-global).

features.title: Optional observability tools
features.description: Use watsonx.ai with observability integrations including [IBM Cloud Logs](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-logs-63d8ae58-fbf3-41ce-b844-0fb5b85882ab-global) for analyzing logs, [IBM Cloud Monitoring](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-monitoring-73debdbf-894f-4c14-81c7-5ece3a70b67d-global) for tracking performance metrics, and [IBM Activity Tracker](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-activity-tracker-918453c3-4f97-4583-8c4a-83ef12fc7916-global) for viewing activity events. These tools provide comprehensive visibility into your watsonx.ai deployment.

diagrams.description:
This deployable architecture provisions an instance of IBM watsonx.ai on IBM Cloud, with the option to integrate additional services to meet enterprise-grade requirements.

It includes watsonx.ai Studio for collaborative model development and watsonx.ai Runtime for deploying machine learning and foundation models, ensuring a seamless development-to-deployment workflow.

To support secure data handling, it provisions IBM Cloud Object Storage for storing project assets. You may also bring an existing instance. Storage delegation is enabled to allow non-admin users to manage their own assets and buckets within the project.

To enhance data security, the architecture provisions IBM Key Protect to manage encryption keys used by the Object Storage instance. You can also supply an existing KMS instance and keys.

User profiles are configured with administrative privileges to ensure proper access control and the ability to manage watsonx.ai resources effectively.

Optionally, you can configure observability services. IBM Cloud Activity Tracker with Event Routing helps monitor access and changes across the environment for audit readiness. IBM Cloud Logs enables collection and analysis of logs generated by watsonx.ai, while IBM Cloud Monitoring captures vital metrics such as CPU and memory usage to help track system performance and usage trends.

After deployment, you will receive a pre-configured watsonx.ai project URL, allowing you to immediately begin building AI solutions tailored to your business needs.

configuration.description: When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance will be configured to collect platform metrics from the provided region. You can configure 1 instance only of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance has already been configured. You may not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance is configured to collect platform metrics from the specified region. ⚠️ You can configure only one instance of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance is already configured. You might not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-account-infra-base
dependencies.description: Cloud automation for account configuration organizes your IBM Cloud account with a ready-made set of resource groups by default. And, when you enable the "with Account Settings" option, it also applies baseline security and governance settings.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-kms
dependencies.description: Enable Cloud automation for Key Protect to use your own managed encryption keys. If disabled, IBM Cloud's default service-managed encryption is used.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cos
dependencies.description: Enable to create an IBM Cloud Object Storage (COS) instance, where a bucket will be set up to store project assets as part of this deployment.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-observability
dependencies.description: Configure IBM Cloud Logs, IBM Cloud Monitoring and IBM Cloud Activity Tracker Event Routing for analyzing logs and metrics generated by the watsonx.ai instance.
